examples/database_import.php
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Use QueryPath's database extension to import XML data into a database.
00004  *
00005  * 
00006  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00007  * @license LGPL The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license.
00008  */
00009 
00010 require_once '../src/QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00011 require_once '../src/QueryPath/Extension/QPDB.php';
00012 
00013 // Set the default database.
00014 QPDB::baseDB('sqlite:../test/db/qpTest.db');
00015 
00016 // To begin, let's create a new database. We can do this outside
00017 // of QueryPath:
00018 $db = QPDB::getBaseDB();
00019 $db->exec('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS qpdb_article (title, author, body)');
00020 
00021 // Here's our sample article:
00022 $article = '<?xml version="1.0"?>
00023 <article>
00024   <title>Use QueryPath for Fun and Profit</title>
00025   <author>
00026     <first>Matt</first>
00027     <last>Butcher</last>
00028   </author>
00029   <body>
00030   <![CDATA[
00031   <p>QueryPath is a great tool.</p>
00032   <p>Use it in many ways.</p>
00033   ]]>
00034   </body>
00035 </article>';
00036 
00037 // Now let's take this article and insert it into the database:
00038 $qp = qp($article);
00039 
00040 // We are going to store our insert params in here.
00041 $params = array();
00042 
00043 // First, let's get the title
00044 $params[':title'] = $qp->find('title')->text();
00045 
00046 // Next, let's get the name:
00047 $params[':name'] = $qp->top()->find('author>last')->text() . ', ' . $qp->prev('first')->text();
00048 
00049 // Finally, let's get the article content:
00050 $params[':body'] = $qp->top()->find('body')->text();
00051 
00052 // Here's the query we are going to run:
00053 $sql = 'INSERT INTO qpdb_article (title, author, body) VALUES (:title, :name, :body)';
00054 
00055 // Now we can insert this:
00056 $qp->query($sql, $params);
00057 
00058 // Finally, we can now read this information back out into an HTML document
00059 qp(QueryPath::HTML_STUB, 'body')->queryInto('SELECT * FROM qpdb_article')->writeHTML();
00060 
00061 // Finally, we clean up:
00062 $qp->exec('DROP TABLE qpdb_article');
